QRL Mainnet

Bootstrap Files

Use these files to speed up the syncing time for a QRL mainnet node.

The most secure approach is to spend the time to fully sync your node from scratch. This ensures your local chain is accurate to all other modes and that you are not running a forked chain. If you don't need this security, you can use these files to bootstrap your node setup.

Un-tar these state files into your local ~/.qrl/data/ folder and start the node. This will start at the latest blockheight these files were made and only sync from there.

State Files

Node Chain Files

Mainnet State QRL_Mainnet_State.tar.gz
Mainnet Checksums Checksums.txt

Snapshot State

Data from the snapshot

Blockheight
blockLastHash
networkId
numConnections
numKnownPeers
state
uptime
version
Unix_Timestamp
Uncompressed_Chain_Size

QRL Testnet

Bootstrap Files

Use these files to speed up the syncing time for a QRL testnet node.

The most secure approach is to spend the time to fully sync your node from scratch. This ensures your local chain is accurate to all other modes and that you are not running a forked chain. If you don't need this security, you can use these files to bootstrap your node setup.

Un-tar these state files into your local ~/.qrl-testnet/data/ folder and start the node. This will start at the latest blockheight these files were made and only sync from there.

State Files

Node Chain Files

Testnet State QRL_Testnet_State.tar.gz
Testnet Checksums Checksums.txt

Snapshot State

Data from the snapshot

blockLastHash
networkId
numConnections
numKnownPeers
state
uptime
version
Unix_Timestamp
Uncompressed_Chain_Size
